name: Ming Zhao 0002
content: Ming Zhao | ASU Search Ming Zhao Associate Professor, School of Computing and Augmented Intelligence Other ASU affiliations Center for Cybersecurity and Trusted Foundations Affiliates Associate Professor, Course Director Fundamentals of AI and Course Director Applications in ME 2, John Shufeldt School of Medicine and Medical Engineering [email protected] Phone: 480-727-7850 ‌ BYENG 412 Temp, AZ 85287 Mail code: 8809 Campus: Tempe ‌ Long Bio Director, Research Laboratory for Virtualized Infrastructures, Systems, & Applications (VISA)Director, ASU NSF IUCRC Center for Accelerated Real Time Analytics (CARTA)Honors Faculty, SCENE MentorSchool of Computing and Augmented Intelligence (SCAI)John Shufeldt School of Medicine and Medical Engineering (affiliated)Arizona State University Dr. Ming Zhao's (''Dr. Z'') directs the Center for Accelerated Real Time Analytics (CARTA) and the Research Lab for Virtualized Infrastructure, Systems, and Applications (VISA). His research interests are in experimental computer systems, including cloud/edge, big-data/machine-learning, and high-performance computing systems as well as operating systems and storage systems in general. He is also highly interested in the cross-disciplinary studies that bridge systems research with other domains, and he has worked with applications from computational physics and chemistry, each sciences, biomedicine, neuroscience, transportation, social science and psychology etc. Dr Z has received the National Science Foundation CAREER award, ASEE Air Force Summer Faculty Fellowship, AWS Machine Learning Research Award, VMware Faculty Award, Intel Faculty Award, Excellence in Mentoring award, Excellence in Research award, and Best Paper award of the International Conference on Autonomic Computing. His PhD students have received the McKnight Doctoral Fellowship, ASEE Air Force Summer Student Fellowship, VMware Graduate Fellowship, and SCAI Doctoral Fellowship. Dr. Z is a Senior Associate Editor of ACM Transactions on Storage (TOS) and an Associate Editor of the Frontiers in High Performance Computing. He served as the General Chair for ACM HPDC, a top conference on high performance distributed computing and General Co-Chair for ACM/IEEE SEC, the flagship conference on edge computing. He also served on the review board of the Natural Sciences and Engineering Research Council of Canada (NSERC) which is the largest funder of scientific research in Canada. Education Ph.D. Electrical and Computer Engineering, University of Florida 2008 M.S. Pattern Recognition and Intelligent Systems, Automation, Tsinghua University, China 2001 B.S. Automation, Tsinghua University, China 1999 Research Website URL https://visa.lab.asu.edu Google Scholar URL https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=pAcF2lEAAAAJ Research Interests Dr. Z's research efforts are targeted to generate both fundamental scientific values and practical societal impacts. I have published over 90 peer-reviewed articles on premiere computer systems conferences and journals, which have been cited more than 3200 times. His research outcomes have also been adopted by several production systems in the industry. His research has been funded by the National Science Foundation, the Department of Homeland Security, the Department of Defense, and industry companies. Research Group CARTA is an NSF-funded Industry-University Cooperative Research Center (IUCRC) that addresses the challenges in real-time data analytics and machine learning using accelerated and next-generation systems. Faculty, spread across four university sites of ASU, Rutgers, UMBC, and U. of Miami participate in collaborative research funded by industry partners who are members of the Center. The fundamental goal of the VISA Research Lab is to explore innovative techniques in virtualization and autonomics in order to effectively utilize the resources in large-scale, dynamic, and complex computing systems and to support the efficient, robust, and secure computing of challenging applications from different domains. Currently, our team is focusing on the projects related to cloud computing, high-performance computing, and big data as well as operating systems and storage systems in general.
